snippet: An auditors’ report found that sexual abuse by friars in the St. Joseph Province of the Capuchin Order was discussed at meetings as far back as 1932.
abstract: Auditors report reveals that sexual abuse by Roman Catholic friars in St Joseph Province of the Capuchin Order was discussed in meetings as far back as 1932, first year for which minutes of meetings were available; newly opened files dating to 19th century and three independent auditors appear to document long-running Catholic Church abuse scandal in United States.
lead_paragraph: An auditors’ report found that sexual abuse by friars in the St. Joseph Province of the Capuchin Order was discussed at meetings as far back as 1932.

headline.main: Audit Finds Sexual Abuse Was Topic Decades Ago
headline.print_headline: Audit Finds Sex Abuse Was Topic Decades Ago
